etymology.description: 饮(drink) + 料(material; ingredients) = liquids prepared for drinking (drinks).
etymology.interpretation: Names liquids prepared for consumption, usually non‑alcoholic. Common for soda, juice, tea, etc., while alcoholic drinks are typically called 酒.
etymology.simplification: 飲 → 饮 by using the simplified food radical 饣 (from 食) and streamlining the right component; 料 unchanged.

parts.english: to drink; drink; to give a drink; imbibe

examples.chinese: 便利店里各种饮料都有(便利店裡各種飲料都有)。
examples.pinyin: Biànlìdiàn lǐ gèzhǒng yǐnliào dōu yǒu.
examples.english: The convenience store has all kinds of beverages.

examples.chinese: 我想点一杯冰的饮料(我想點一杯冰的飲料)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng diǎn yì bēi bīng de yǐnliào.
examples.english: I’d like to order a cold drink.

examples.chinese: 运动后要补充水分，少喝含糖饮料(運動後要補充水分，少喝含糖飲料)。
examples.pinyin: Yùndòng hòu yào bǔchōng shuǐfèn, shǎo hē hántáng yǐnliào.
examples.english: After exercising, replenish fluids and drink fewer sugary beverages.
